data.title: John Cleese Answers the Proust Questionnaire
data.meta_description: The English actor answers our signature interrogative.
data.text:
What is your idea of perfect happiness? The demise of the London Daily Mail.

What is your greatest fear? Fear itself.

Which historical figure do you most identify with? Dirk Stoat. He had no desire for fame.

Which living person do you most admire? The Dalai Lama.

What is the trait you most deplore in yourself? Self-criticism.

What is the trait you most deplore in others? Lack of self-criticism.

What is your greatest extravagance? My ex-wife, Alyce Faye Eichelberger-Cleese.

What is your favorite journey? Home.

What do you consider the most overrated virtue? Physical courage.

On what occasion do you lie? Most.

What do you dislike most about your appearance? My cruel ears.

Which living person do you most despise? Rupert Murdoch, destroyer of cultures.

Which words or phrases do you most overuse? “Stop polishing that antelope.”

What is your greatest regret? Having no regrets.

What or who is the greatest love of your life? Fish.

When and where were you happiest? Now, here.

Which talent would you most like to have? Cunning.

What is your current state of mind? Ineffable bliss.

If you could change one thing about yourself, what would it be? My bank balance.

If you could change one thing about your family, what would it be? My mother. I'll have Auntie Peggy instead.

What do you consider your greatest achievement? Writing Beethoven's Pastoral Symphony, No. 6.

If you were to die and come back as a person or thing, what do you think it would be? I would like to be my own cat.

If you could choose what to come back as, what would it be? I just told you.

What is your most treasured possession? My life.

What do you regard as the lowest depth of misery? Working for the Daily Mail.

Where would you like to live? Bath.

What is your favorite occupation? Wasp farming.

What is your most marked characteristic? My air of nonchalance, insouciance, and devil-may-care.

What is the quality you most like in a man? A tendency to fawn.

What is the quality you most like in a woman? Dolichocephaly.

What do you most value in your friends? Omertà.

Who are your favorite writers? Tolstoy, George Eliot, Alan Furst, John le Carré, Jerome K. Jerome, and Kingsley Amis.

Who is your favorite hero of fiction? Flashman.

Who are your heroes in real life? Most people, as they are doing their best.

What are your favorite names? Walt, Bart, Art.

What is it that you most dislike? Halibut ice cream and cheats.

How would you like to die? On my 250th birthday.
